value.title: Companies Will Spend $50 Billion On Artificial Intelligence This Year With Little To Show For It
value.excerpt: Despite an AI investing boom, only 10% of companies report significant financial returns from the technology, new research shows.

value.title: Chinese Delivery Platform Meituan-Dianping Trials First-Ever Smart AI Retail Store

value.title: Companies Are Rushing to Use AI—but Few See a Payoff
value.excerpt: A study finds that only 11 percent of firms that have deployed artificial intelligence are reaping a “sizable” return on their investments.

value.title: ONR Robotics enter the COVID-19 fight
value.excerpt: A decontamination robot funded by the Office of Naval Research (ONR) and designed by several local universities was recently tested in Richmond Va. The robot--initially designed for shipboard firefighting and maintenance tasks--has now been enlisted in the fight against Covid-19.

value.title: DeepMind open-sources the FermiNet, a neural network that simulates electron behaviors
value.excerpt: Researchers at DeepMind have open-sourced the FermiNet, a neural network that simulates the positions and arrangements of electrons.

value.title: Baker McKenzie launches global innovation unit, teaming up with AI company
value.excerpt: Baker McKenzie on Monday launched a new innovation arm, Reinvent Law, bringing the global firm's existing innovation efforts under a single umbrella and pairing them with a new artificial intelligence joint venture.

value.title: A global collaboration to move artificial intelligence principles to practice
value.excerpt: Convened by the MIT Schwarzman College of Computing, the AI Policy Forum is a global collaboration to move AI principles to practice.

value.title: Juniper acquires 128 Technology for $450 million as it builds out its AI
value.excerpt: Juniper Networks said it will acquire 128 Technology for $450 million in a move that will give it more artificial intelligence-based features through its networking portfolio. The company said it will it will acquire 128 Technology with cash and assumption of equity awards.

value.title: Culture And People Will Drive Tech Innovation And Growth
value.excerpt: Now, we’re seeing many companies shift from the automation-focused initiatives of the early 2000s to recognise the role of human intelligence in building smarter, more innovative automations and AI.

value.title: Google’s Lending DocAI streamlines mortgage applications with artificial intelligence
